macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: S&P 500 Flat, Down 0.14% for Week Ending January 16, 2026
items.summary: The S&P 500 dropped 9.95 points to close at 6,940 on Friday, marking a 0.14% decline amid choppy trading with a weekly high of 6,985 and low of 6,890. December CPI showed 0.3% monthly increase matching expectations, while core inflation rose 0.2% below forecasts, with annual rate at 2.7%.

items.title: Dow Jones Gains Slightly, Up 87 Points to 49,359 for Week
items.summary: The Dow made a weekly high of 49,587 on Monday and low of 48,879 on Wednesday, closing Friday at 49,359 for a modest weekly gain. Markets showed rangebound trading amid inflation data and retail sales releases.

items.title: Nasdaq Ends Week Down 145 Points at 25,529
items.summary: Nasdaq hit a weekly high of 25,809 on Monday and low of 25,280 on Wednesday, closing Friday at 25,529 amid rangebound action. U.S. stocks overall finished flat, with semiconductor gains offset by weaker banks and policy headlines.

items.title: Small Caps Lead Market Rotation as IWM Shows Strength
items.summary: Russell 2000 (IWM) leads with strong weekly structure and higher highs, signaling risk appetite in small and mid-caps. Industrials (DIA) steady, S&P 500 (SPY) consolidating, Nasdaq (QQQ) lagging in selective stock-picker's market.

items.title: US Stocks Flat Amid Earnings Strength and Policy Noise
items.summary: Major equity indexes dipped slightly this week after strong 2025 gains, with volatility rising amid policy headlines; semiconductor bids offset softer bank performance. Investors focus on US earnings resilience despite noise.

items.title: Upcoming PCE Data Key Amid Stable Rate Expectations
items.summary: Financial markets brace for volatile week with PCE data potentially pivotal for US Dollar tied to steady interest rates. Bitcoin consolidates above $90,000 in selective crypto flows.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Options Open Interest Surpasses Futures for First Time
items.summary: Bitcoin options open interest reached $74.1 billion, overtaking futures open interest of $65.22 billion. This milestone signals a shift in how institutions hedge positions and may influence Bitcoin's volatility patterns around key strikes and expiries.

items.title: Ethereum Staking Validator Exit Queue Reaches Zero
items.summary: Ethereum's staking validator exit queue has cleared to zero, boosting confidence in ETH and signaling improved network stability.

items.title: Stanford Professor Unveils New Zero-Knowledge Proof Protocol for Bitcoin
items.summary: A Stanford professor has introduced a new zero-knowledge proof protocol designed for Bitcoin, advancing privacy and scalability capabilities.

items.title: Solana Network Experiences Surge in Active Addresses and Transactions
items.summary: Solana has seen increased network activity with a notable surge in active addresses and transaction volume.

items.title: U.S. Senate Faces Challenges in Passing Crypto Market Structure Bill
items.summary: The U.S. Senate is encountering obstacles in advancing cryptocurrency market structure legislation.

items.title: U.S. Bitcoin Strategic Reserve Development Faces Legal Challenges
items.summary: The development of a U.S. Bitcoin strategic reserve is encountering legal obstacles.

items.title: Tokenized Asset Market Projected to Reach $400 Billion by 2026
items.summary: Market projections indicate the tokenized asset sector is expected to grow to $400 billion by the end of 2026.

items.title: Bitcoin Traders Price $100K Target at 42% Probability
items.summary: Prediction markets show traders assigning a 42% probability to Bitcoin reaching $100,000, with forecasts suggesting prices near $98,000 by month-end.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: CES Declares 2026 the Year of Physical AI
items.summary: CES has declared 2026 the year of Physical AI, with rapid developments including healthcare as AI's new battleground, xAI raising $20B, and Meta's Llama team admitting benchmark manipulation issues.

items.title: Mercedes CLA Ships with Full NVIDIA Autonomous Stack
items.summary: Mercedes becomes the first production vehicle to ship with NVIDIA's complete autonomous AI stack, adopting a Tesla-like OTA update model over proprietary tech.

items.title: Boston Dynamics to Deploy Atlas Robots at Hyundai by 2028
items.summary: Boston Dynamics announced Atlas humanoid robots will deploy at Hyundai manufacturing facilities by 2028, highlighting the Physical AI market potential.

items.title: Etched Raises $500M for AI Inference Chips Challenging NVIDIA
items.summary: Etched secured $500M to develop specialized AI inference chips, joining competitors like Groq and Cerebras in eroding NVIDIA's dominance.

items.title: AMD and OpenAI Formalize Major Partnership
items.summary: AMD and OpenAI announced a major partnership to diversify OpenAI's supply chain away from NVIDIA's dominance.

items.title: Apple Partners with Google to Power AI Siri with Gemini
items.summary: Apple and Google announced a multi-year $1B/year deal for Gemini to power AI Siri, marking Apple's shift from internal LLM development.

items.title: Yann LeCun Confirms Llama 4 Benchmark Manipulation
items.summary: Meta's Chief AI Scientist Yann LeCun revealed Llama 4's benchmark scores were manipulated, eroding confidence in the team's real-world capabilities.

items.title: Google's Gemini 3 Pro Dominates AI Model Benchmarks
items.summary: Google leads end-of-January AI model markets with 92-96% probabilities, driven by Gemini 3 Pro's superior Elo and other benchmark performance.

items.title: Thinking Machines Lab Faces Major Implosion After CTO Firing
items.summary: Thinking Machines Lab, post-$2B seed, fired CTO Barret Zoph on January 14, 2026, amid turmoil questioning its future in frontier AI models.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Commodore Industries Announces The NewZealand Story Reboot for Steam
items.summary: Commodore Industries (not the relaunched C64 maker) has confirmed an official update of Taito's classic The NewZealand Story, featuring new enemies and content, set to launch on Steam next month.

items.title: GPC Video Charts Crown Star Wars Battle Pod Update as Number One
items.summary: The latest GPC Video Chart Show highlights Star Wars Battle Pod's The Force Awakens update as the top game, with Go With the Flow on Spectrum Next at number two and an upcoming demo generating excitement.

items.title: Video Game Backlogs Evolve in 2026 Amid Live-Service Trends
items.summary: In 2026, video game backlogs are transforming due to live-service games, server shutdowns erasing unfinished titles, and even single-player games receiving ongoing updates, making completion more challenging.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
